body.name: Write Your First Novel
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Gilbert Morris, Ph.D. (1929-2016) was a professor of English at Ouachita Baptist University in Arkansas for twenty-four years. He was the author of more than 230 novels in his career with nearly seven million copies of his novels sold worldwide He is considered by many to be "the grandfather of Christian historical fiction."Steve Laube, president of both The Steve Laube Agency and the Christian Writers Institute. He also serves as the Publisher for Enclave Publishing. He has been in the book business for over forty years. He began as a bookseller, then became an editor, and now serves as a literary agent and publisher. The Agency can be found at SteveLaube.com, the Institute at ChristianWritersInstitute.com, and the publisher at EnclavePublishing.com.

body.description: You Can Become a Successful NovelistForeword by Jerry B. Jenkins This book will revolutionize the way you write and create stories! With step-by-step instructions from two publishing veterans, you'll learn the essential elements of plot, character development, dialogue, and setting. This book will give you the confidence to create stories that captivate readers and the knowledge to take your writing to the next level. What's Included in This Book: - Strategies to write gripping stories that readers won't be able to put down - Techniques to make your characters come alive on the page - Tips to realistically portray settings and dialogue - Advice on how to develop your plot and keep readers hooked “You need to read this book if you want to be a better writer.” — Dallas Jenkins, creator of The Chosen “Reading this book is like sitting at the feet of two stellar teachers as they unpack the secrets to fiction writing.” — Steven James, Christy Award Hall of Fame author, and author of Story Trumps Structure “Practical, instructive, thorough, and useful for the new writer, old writer, and aspiring writer alike.” — Nadine Brandes, three-time Carol Award-winning YA author “The lessons you learn in this book will serve you the rest of your writing life.” — James Scott Bell, Christy Award-winning author, and author of Write Your Novel from the Middle “An amazingly valuable resource. This will now become one of my go-to resources when training writers, too!” — Tricia Goyer, USA Today best-selling author and mentor at WriteThatBook.Club “Laube’s additions to Morris’s classic work are full of Christian wisdom and down-to-earth advice from someone who knows the industry inside and out.” — Kyle Mann, best-selling novelist and Editor-in-Chief, The Babylon Bee Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as advertised
reviews.reviewText: Don’t understand the need for a review on this type of purchase

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For any writer who wants to write their first novel
reviews.reviewText: Highly recommend any book written by Steve Laube, friend, editor, agent, to so many writers across the industry. Laube's insight to what makes great fiction writing will boost your writing skills, knowledge, and confidence.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Essential for Every Author
reviews.reviewText: This book is an essential for every author’s toolbox. It is like a crash course on storytelling, covering all the bases in a very condensed and accessible way that was a great refresher! I’m working on my fifth novel now, and this book is one I will definitely be pulling out during the editing process! Highly recommend to anyone serious about a career as an author!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Helpful book for anyone beginning their writing journey. Great refresher for those who have been writing a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Supremely practical, yet entertaining to read.
reviews.reviewText: Write Your First Novel is like a writers conference in a book. This is a comprehensive manual for the first-time author or a great tool for the seasoned novelist who needs a refresher course or a shot of inspiration from two pros. Supremely practical, yet entertaining to read. I highly recommend.
